Sounds like either the a test or a non-test file gets changed, bitcoin core (the src dir?) needs to be recompiled. Then when is `make -C src/test` relevant? Because this command only compiles what is in `src/test` right, instead of bitcoin core itself?

Tests depend on individual source files, not all of `bitcoind`. So if you're working on `src/descriptor.cpp` it's faster to do `make -C src/test && src/test/test_bitcoin  --run_test=descriptor_tests`

> Tests depend on individual source files, not all of bitcoind\n\nI don't think this is true. Tests depend on all the libraries that bitcoind depends on. The only thing they don't depend on is bitcoind.cpp
